subject: RE: [JUnit] unit testing - EJB - RemoteException and NoClassDefFoundError
msgSnippet: thanks mike. i figured it out.  i had all kinds of classpath problems that i had to configure on visual cafe.  once that was done, everything was cool. ...
messageBody:
thanks mike.
i figured it out. i had all kinds of classpath problems that i had to
configure on visual cafe. once that was done, everything was cool.

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 23, 2001 6:12 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [JUnit] unit testing - EJB - RemoteException and
NoClassDefFoundError


You'll also want to make sure that the system CLASSPATH (the one used by

JWhich by default) is the same classpath as that being used by JUnit.
If you're running tests from an IDE or Ant, they may be configured with
different CLASSPATH settings.

Mike

Choe, Mike wrote:

> i think my classpath is fine. the javax.ejb.Handle object is in my
> classpath. i ran JWhich to verify it.
>
> C:\>java JWhich javax.ejb.Handle
>
> Class 'javax.ejb.Handle' found in
> 'file:/C:/VisualCafeEE/Java/lib/javax_ejb.zip!/javax/ejb/Handle.class'
>
> Classpath:
> ..
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib
> C:\VisualCafeEE\bin\xutil.ZIP
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\SYMCLASS.ZIP
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\CLASSES.ZIP
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\COLLECTIONS.ZIP
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\ICEBROWSERBEAN.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\xml.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\SYMTOOLS.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\swing-1.1\SWINGALL.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Bin\Components\SFC.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Bin\Components\SYMBEANS.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\DBAW.ZIP
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Bin\Components\DBAW_AWT.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Bin\Components\Databind.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\ERADTOOLS.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\ERADPUBLIC.JAR
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\servlet.jar
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\webserver.jar
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Bin\Components\templates.jar
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\javax_ejb.ZIP
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\jndi.jar
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Java\Lib\jts.zip
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Bin\Components\vcejbwl.jar
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Bin\sb
> C:\VisualCafeEE\Bin\sb\classes\sb.jar
> C:\weblogic\mssqlserver4v70\license
> C:\junit.jar
> C:\weblogic\classes
>
> C:\>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 23, 2001 2:25 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [JUnit] unit testing - EJB - RemoteException and
> NoClassDefFoundError
>
>
> --- "Choe, Mike" <mchoe@...> wrote:
>
>> hello all.
>> i am trying to unit test my entity bean after deploying it on
>> weblogic
>> 5.1 server. the test bombs when i execute "home.create( )". for
>> some
>> reason the junit client is unable to talk to the server. anyone know
>> what the problem may be? here is the output message from JUnit.
>>
>> -----------------
>> There was 1 failure:
>> 1) testCreate(test.com.gensys.framework.ejb.GsUserSessionTest) ";
>> nested
>> excepti
>> on is:
>> weblogic.rmi.ServerError: A RemoteException occurred in the
>> server metho
>> d
>> - with nested exception:
>> [java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Ljavax/ejb/Handle;]"
>>
>> FAILURES!!!
>> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
>> ----------------------
>>
>
>
> Verify that the JVM running the test has the javax.ejb package in the
> CLASSPATH (ejb.jar). The server is probably trying to marshal the
> Handle object to the client, and it can't be unmarshalled given the
> current CLASSPATH.
>
> Mike
>
>
